entry.title: The instruction at ... referenced memory at ... The memory could not be read
entry.content:

I made a Addon with SDK, this addon work out of SAP and for some time now, it gives an error when recording payments or entries in SAP, the error that appears is "The instruction at ... referenced memory at ... The memory could not be read"

 

I use SAP BO v10 with Hana

 

Regards

entry.title: General Ledger Report not showing Dimensions data
entry.content:
Our company recently migrated to version 10 of SAP Business One.

When executing the General Ledger report, the Dimensions' information appears blank; that doesn't happen if we run the Cost Accounting reports. 

We have been working with dimensions for years in the previous versions and the information always appeared in the report.

Was there any major configuration change in the new version in regards of dimensions that might be missing?

The General Ledger report is used by all of our users and it is causing a major problem.

Any help is really appreciated.

entry.title: Invalid path on crystal reports
entry.content:
We have two computers here running SAP Business One. On one machine, trying to preview or import a Crystal Report yields the error "ungültiger Pfad für Berichtsdatei" (Invalid path for report file) - heck, why don't you write *what* path has been tried here and where it came from, to give even a chance to solve this?

The other machine can do this. I already deleted all in %temp%, I already started anew multiple times. To no avail.

So, how can I get rid of this error? It is not the report, we know from the other machine that it works.

entry.title: SAP B1 IR/GR 8% threshold, invoice/credit posting
entry.content:
Dear SAP Community,

I need your advice on how to correctly post two documents—an invoice and a credit memo—when the 8% tolerance limit is active. As you know, this setting prevents invoice posting if the difference between the goods receipt (GR) and the invoice receipt (IR) exceeds 8%.

Here is the scenario:

  • A purchase order (PO) was created for €800.

  • A GR was posted for €800.

  • The supplier mistakenly issued an invoice for €2,400, and later issued a credit memo for €1,600 to correct the error.

When attempting to post the €2,400 invoice, SAP throws an error due to the IR exceeding the GR by more than 8%.

My question:
Is the only way to proceed as follows?

  1. Cancel the original GR.

  2. Adjust the PO amount from €800 to €2,400.

  3. Re-post the GR for €2,400.

  4. Post the €2,400 invoice.

  5. Finally, post the €1,600 credit memo.

Is there a better or more efficient approach to handle this situation within SAP?

Thanks in advance for your help!

Best regards,

Tom

entry.title: Need libgcrypt.so.11.7.0 when install SAP B1 SLD 9.3 on SLES 12 SP3
entry.content:
Hello,

My company use old SAP 9.3 on HANA, today I want to install SAP B1 SLD but there is error

sap-bo-svr:/sap-setup/Packages.Linux/ServerComponents # ./install
error: Failed dependencies:
/lib64/libgcrypt.so.11.7.0 is needed by B1ServerToolsSupport-9.3014004-0.x86_64
libopenssl0_9_8 >= 0.9.8h is needed by B1ServerToolsSupport-9.3014004-0.x86_64
/usr/bin/rpmbuild is needed by B1ServerToolsSupport-9.3014004-0.x86_64

I cannot found libgcrypt.so.11.7 ... to download because our company don't have suse subscription.

Please help me. Thank you very much.

entry.title: Add-on does not upload in Extension Manager
entry.content:
Hi everyone, I am facing an issue related to installing an Add-on on the Extension Manager.

On another machine, after clicking Import -> Browse -> selecting the SDK file, nothing appears on the screen, so the installation cannot proceed afterwards. The image below is the issue.

However, on my machine, after selecting the file, the SDK file still shows up, and the installation works normally. I am not sure what causes this error and how to fix it.
Thanks in advance.

entry.title: SAP B1 items transfere to bin managed warehouse
entry.content:
Hello guys

Recently i have created a new warehouse location managed by bin location.

And i have groupe of items need to transfered to that new managed by bin location warehouse using inventory transfer

Want to assign diffrent bin location for each item in the inventory transfer document

The avilable bin location comes as either the default bin location or historical bin location.. what if i want to assign a new been location out of those 2 options.

How can i let all bin locations in the warehouse avilable for all the items ..

Seeking your support guys..

Thank you SAP Business One

entry.title: SAP B1 Service Layer – Order creation fails with “Bad Post Content” (valid JSON payload)
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I’m trying to create a sales order via SAP Business One Service Layer, but I always get the error “Bad Post Content” when posting the JSON payload.

Here’s the exact JSON I’m sending:

{
  "CardCode": "680076",
  "NumAtCard": "907873",
  "DocDate": "2025-09-29",
  "DocDueDate": "2025-09-30",
  "DocCurrency": "EUR",
  "DocumentLines": [
    {
      "FreeText": "4430023",
      "ItemCode": "L1-0-0-XXX",
      "UnitPrice": 8.8000000000000007,
      "Quantity": 1,
      "WarehouseCode": "01"
    },
    {
      "FreeText": "4430039",
      "ItemCode": "CK-32-50001-701-M",
      "UnitPrice": 5.9299999999999997,
      "Quantity": 2,
      "WarehouseCode": "01"
    }
  ],
  "Comments": "Generert fra LOGONv3 (TransferID: 1759208)",
  "U_Lokasjon": "TOTAL station Andreas Froehlich"
}

What I’ve verified so far:

  • CardCode is valid and active.
  • Both ItemCode values exist.
  • WarehouseCode = "01" exists.
  • DocCurrency = "EUR" is supported in this database.
  • UDF U_Lokasjon exists as a string field.

Any hints or ideas are much appreciated!
Thanks in advance.

entry.title: Mass uploading sales orders via DTW, how can I trigger Avatax to calculate/update them?
entry.content:
Hi, 

I am mass uploading sales orders into our SAP b1 system, but I need to figure out how to trigger the avatax calculations in mass. If I edit a comment or remark and press update on a sales order, that triggers the refresh I cant seem to figure out how to update many sales orders at a time. Does anyone know a way to mass trigger updates / calculations for sales orders?

entry.title: FATAL ERROR: XS_HOST_NOT_FOUND
entry.content:
Dear All,
Has anyone encountered this issue?
Background:
Ihave SBO 9.1 PL09 HANA installed and the Fiori style cockpit enabled in the database I am connecting too. If I log onto the terminal server as administrator and start business one then everything works fine. when business one starts: FATAL ERROR: XS_HOST_NOT_FOUND.
This appears to the linked to the Fiori Style Cockpit.
Any help would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks

entry.title: Formatted Search Issue
entry.content:
Sorry if this is duplicate, I don't know if the other one posted.
I setup a formatted search that divides the unit price / qty per unit (Unit Price = $24.00 /Qty per Unit = 12) = $2.00

The user defined field is U_AIS_Price_Each, is setup as a Type Units and Totals, Structure Price

When the sales order screen opens, I get this message:
[Microsoft][ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server][SQL Server]Error converting data type nvarchar to numeric. FMS execution failed on field 'U_AIS_Price_Each' with query name 'SO - Price Each II'

The field is setup to refresh on Item or Unit Price changing, if change it on the sales order line item, it calculates properly, but opening the screen is the problem.

This is the formatted search

SELECT
CAST(REPLACE($[$38.17.0], '$', '') AS DECIMAL(18,2)) /
CAST(REPLACE($[$38.213.NUMBER], '$', '') AS DECIMAL(18,2))

Thanks for your help in advance.

entry.title: Service Layer – Unable to Close Inventory Transfer Request (Error -1 detected during transaction)
entry.content:
Hello experts,

I’m trying to use the Service Layer to close an Inventory Transfer Request.

I tested using:

 

http
Copy
POST https://localhost:50000/b1s/v2/InventoryTransferRequests(123)/Close

 

POST https://localhost:50000/b1s/v2/InventoryTransferRequests(123)/Close

Or:

 

http
Copy
POST https://localhost:50000/b1s/v2/InventoryTransferRequests(123) { "Comments": "new comments - modified by Service Layer" }

 

POST https://localhost:50000/b1s/v2/InventoryTransferRequests(123) { "Comments": "new comments - modified by Service Layer" }

In both cases, I get the following error:

 

json
Copy
{ "error": { "code": -1116, "message": { "lang": "en-us", "value": "Could not commit transaction: Error -1 detected during transaction" } } }

 

{ "error": { "code": -1116, "message": { "lang": "en-us", "value": "Could not commit transaction: Error -1 detected during transaction" } } }

If I perform the same operation manually in the SAP B1 client, it works fine.

I also tried closing the lines first and then the document, but I still get the same error:

 

http
Copy
PATCH https://localhost:50000/b1s/v2/InventoryTransferRequests(123) { "DocumentStatus": "bost_Close", "StockTransferLines": [ { "LineNum": 0, "DocEntry": 123, "ItemCode": "000-000102", "LineStatus": "bost_Close" }, { "LineNum": 3, "DocEntry": 123, "ItemCode": "000-000117", "LineStatus": "bost_Close" } ] }
PATCH https://localhost:50000/b1s/v2/InventoryTransferRequests(123) { "DocumentStatus": "bost_Close", "StockTransferLines": [ { "LineNum": 0, "DocEntry": 123, "ItemCode": "000-000102", "LineStatus": "bost_Close" }, { "LineNum": 3, "DocEntry": 123, "ItemCode": "000-000117", "LineStatus": "bost_Close" } ] }

➡️ Question: What is the correct way to close an Inventory Transfer Request through the Service Layer? Is there any limitation or specific requirement before calling the /Close action?

Thanks in advance for your help!
